title: 110_s454
content: The Act titled "Improving Access to Higher Education Act of 2007" increases Federal Pell Grants. The Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to increase Federal Pell Grants, with changes including raising the grant amount to $5,100 for the academic year 2007-2008. The Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to increase Federal Pell Grants to $500 for each student for the year 2007-2008, with an additional $4,331,000,000 appropriated for this purpose. The Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to increase Federal Pell Grants by $1,050 for award year 2007-2008, with an additional $4,331,000,000 appropriated for this purpose. The amendments will take effect on July 1, 2007. Expansion of deduction for interest on education loans. Increased Limitation on Deduction for Interest on Education Loans: The maximum deduction allowed for the taxable year is now $3,750, with an increase in the phaseout threshold to $75,000 ($150,000 for joint filers). Conforming amendments have been made to the Internal Revenue Code to reflect these changes. The deduction for interest on education loans has been increased to $3,750 for the taxable year, with a phaseout threshold of $75,000 ($150,000 for joint filers). Amendments to the Internal Revenue Code have been made to reflect these changes. The amendments made by this section apply to taxable years starting after December 31, 2006. Repeal of EGTRRA Sunset does not affect the elimination of the 60-month limit and increase in income limitation on student loan interest deduction. SEC. 4. COVERDELL EDUCATION SAVINGS ACCOUNTS. Increase in allowable contributions for Coverdell Education Savings Accounts from $2,000 to $3,000. Amendments also include changes in reporting requirements with reports due by June 30 of the following year. Effective date for these amendments is specified. The reporting requirements for Coverdell Education Savings Accounts have been amended to require reports to be filed by June 30 of the following year. The amendments will apply to taxable years starting after December 31, 2006, and the sunset provisions of the Economic Growth and Tax Relief Reconciliation Act of 2001 will not apply to modifications to education individual retirement accounts. Section 411 of the Economic Growth and Tax Relief Reconciliation Act of 2001, regarding employer-provided educational assistance, is exempt from the sunset provisions of the Act.
